page.section:
Belgia 1590 stilo Rom 15 Janum to M
r
Bodley
page.lettertext:
S
r
, yo
r
ceadinges in yo
r
Charge there [general]
as also in the
ticuler matter of
Ostend
, are ver[y]
well liked, both by her
Ma
tie
, and
my lordes
, but
espetiallie by the
Lord Th
re
r
.
The dillatorie answeare made by the
States
, is by
us here, much misliked of, being answearable
to the rest of the Carriage of themselfes towardes
her Ma
tie
. Yo
r
motion for a Coppie
to be requyred of their Comission is well liked
of, as a thinge most necessarie, But it is
thought they will make difficultie to yeald
it, thoughe in reason they cannott [denie] it.
We are nowe in hand w
th
the
lord of Buckhurstes
dispatche, who is nothinge willing to accept
the Charge, and it groweth here disputable
whether it were not better to send over m
r
doctor Clarcke
, or
m
r
Wylkes
, to acquainte
the States w
th
the materiall pointes of his Charg[e]
to the end they maie have ample Comission
to treate w
th
his L. when he shall come.
Touchinge yo
r
request w
ch
S
r
Horatio Pallavi-
cino
im
ted unto me, for lycence to come home
for 3 or 4 monethes to setle yo
r
privatt estate,
I have moved her Ma
tie
therein, but doe find
in her no disposition to yeald thereunto.
And
so I Comitt you to god From the
Cort at
Rychmond
the 15
th
of Januarie 1589
Yo
r
assured frend Francis Walsingham
Heer i nclosed I nowe send you
a Coppie of the order w
ch
was
omitted in the last dispatche
